title: Baseline personnel security standard (BPSS)
description:
generally used as pre-employment checks. Ascertains the
trustworthiness and reliability of a prospective candidate, looking at
Identity, Employment history, Nationality and immigration status, and
Criminal record

title: Counter terrorist check (CTC)
description:
is carried out if an individual is working in proximity to public figures, or
requires unescorted access to certain military, civil, industrial or
commercial establishments assessed to be at particular risk from
terrorist attack

title: Security check (SC)
description:
determines that a person’s character and personal circumstances are
such that they can be trusted to work in a position which involves longterm, frequent and uncontrolled access to SECRET assets

title: Developed vetting (DV)
description:
in addition to SC, this detailed check is appropriate when an individual
has long term, frequent and uncontrolled access to ‘Top Secret’
information. There is also Enhanced DV

title: Basic DBS
description:
for any purpose, including employment. The certificate will contain
details of convictions and conditional cautions that are considered to be
unspent

title: Standard DBS
description:
contains details of both spent and unspent convictions, cautions,
reprimands and warnings that are held on the Police National Computer

title: Enhanced DBS
description:
as per the Standard DBS, plus also searches the DBS Barred Lists, inc the
Children’s Barred List

title: Disclosure Scotland Basic
description: a criminal record check, containing unspent criminal convictions

title: Disclosure Scotland Standard
description:
contains information on convictions and cautions, information from Sex
Offenders Register

title: Disclosure Scotland Enhanced
description:
contains information on convictions and cautions, information from Sex
Offenders Register

title: Protecting Vulnerable Groups (PVG) scheme
description:
contains conviction information, and any other non-conviction
information that the police or other government bodies think is relevant

title: AccessNI Basic
description: contains details of all convictions considered to be unspent

title: AccessNI Standard
description:
contains details of all spent and unspent convictions, informed
warnings, cautions and diversionary youth conferences

title: AccessNI Enhanced
description:
contains the same information as a standard check and police records
held locally. To work with children and vulnerable adults, the check may
include information held by the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS)
